definition[0]: if you devolve responsibility, power etc to a person or group at a lower level, or if it devolves on them, it is given to them
example[0]: The federal government has devolved responsibility for welfare to the states.
example[1]: Half of the cost of the study will devolve upon the firm.
definition[1]: if land, money etc devolves to someone, it becomes their property when someone else dies
definition[2]: to give work, responsibility, or power to someone at a lower or more local level
example[2]: The goal of the welfare bill is to devolve power and responsibility to the states.
definition[3]: if land, goods etc devolve to someone they become the property of that person when their owner dies
example[3]: In the event of the guardian dying before the child attains twenty-one years, all of the estate shall devolve upon the said child and be held for him in trust.
